                "In a perfect capital market, a firm's market capitalization would change when it borrows to repurchase shares.", 
                answer="Callable bonds give the issuer the right to redeem the bonds before their maturity date, while non-callable bonds cannot be redeemed by the issuer before maturity.",
                "Callable bonds usually offer a lower yield than non-callable bonds, which makes them less attractive to investors.", 
                "Bond covenants are legally binding agreements that set specific terms and conditions for bond issuers and bondholders, but they cannot include restrictions on the issuer's activities.")
cat(q1,longmcq(q1_choices))
